snippet: Some of New York City’s lever machines broke down and even some candidates had to resort to paper ballots Tuesday, but it was not a full-scale electoral disaster.
abstract: New York City’s old-fashioned lever voting machines are blamed for some problems at polling places, but are not a full-scale electoral disaster; in cases where machines had broken down, voters had to resort to an even older technology, pen and paper; Board of Elections says anecdotal evidence suggests the lever machines performed well, and that technicians were able to respond swiftly to problems.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Liz Robbins, Marc Santora, Nate Schweber and Kate Taylor.

lead_paragraph: Some of New York City’s lever machines broke down and even some candidates had to resort to paper ballots Tuesday, but it was not a full-scale electoral disaster.

headline.main: At Polls, Return of Levers Brings Problems and Praise
headline.print_headline: At Polls, Return of Levers Brings Problems and Praise
